metadata.feature_description: Provides drag-and-drop column resizing functionality in edit mode for visual layout adjustments.

steps.action: Entered Edit mode on Home page
steps.expected: Page enters edit mode showing Content Layout modules with panes
steps.actual: Edit mode activated, Content Layout modules visible with panes F30A_Pane1-4 and 9977_Pane1-4

steps.action: Scrolled to view Content Layout modules
steps.expected: Content Layout modules with 4-column layout visible
steps.actual: Two 4-column Content Layout modules visible (TELEVISIONS/WEARABLES/TABLETS/LAPTOPS and HOME THEATERS/BLU-RAY PLAYERS/MONITORS/CAMERAS)

steps.action: Hovered over resize handle between columns
steps.expected: Size viewer appears showing column percentages
steps.actual: Size viewer appeared showing 25% for all 4 columns

steps.action: Dragged resize handle to the right by 100 pixels
steps.expected: Column widths change dynamically during drag
steps.actual: First column expanded to 36%, second column shrunk to 14%, size viewer updated in real-time

steps.expected: Resize completes and column widths are applied
steps.actual: Resize completed successfully, columns retained new sizes, size viewer faded out

steps.action: Dragged resize handle far to the left (300 pixels) to test minimum width
steps.expected: Column should stop at minimum width (105px / ~10-13%)
steps.actual: First column stopped at 13%, could not be resized smaller despite dragging 300px. Second column expanded to 37%.

steps.action: Dragged resize handle far to the right (400 pixels) to test maximum width
steps.expected: Column expansion should stop when adjacent column reaches minimum width
steps.actual: First column expanded to 41%, second column shrunk to 9% (minimum), column couldn't expand further

steps.expected: Resize completes with column at maximum width
steps.actual: Resize completed, columns retained sizes at constraint boundaries

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify resize updates persist after save

steps.action: Reloaded the page after resize changes
steps.expected: Column sizes should persist after page reload
steps.actual: Page reloaded successfully and entered edit mode

steps.action: Hovered over resize handle to verify persisted sizes
steps.expected: Size viewer should show the previously set custom sizes
steps.actual: Size viewer displayed persisted sizes: 33%, 17%, 25%, 25% (columns retained custom widths after reload)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test resize with multiple columns (4-column layout)

steps.action: Hovered over second Content Layout module (9977) to show size viewer
steps.expected: Size viewer should show 25% for all 4 columns in the second layout
steps.actual: Size viewer displayed 25% for HOME THEATERS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, CAMERAS

steps.action: Dragged resize handle between MONITORS and CAMERAS columns
steps.expected: Only adjacent columns (MONITORS and CAMERAS) should be affected
steps.actual: MONITORS expanded to 33%, CAMERAS shrunk to 17%, other columns (HOME THEATERS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS) remained at 25%

steps.action: Released mouse to complete resize on second module
steps.expected: Resize completes and affects only the resized columns
steps.actual: Resize completed successfully, only MONITORS and CAMERAS columns changed, other columns unaffected

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify resize UI feedback (size viewer percentages)

steps.expected: Size viewer badges should appear on all columns showing percentages
steps.actual: Size viewer badges appeared with semi-transparent dark background showing percentage values (e.g., '25%') centered on each column

steps.expected: Size viewer percentages should update in real-time
steps.actual: Size viewer updated dynamically showing changing percentages (e.g., 36%/14%) as columns were resized
Size viewer faded out after resize operation completed

observations: The resize functionality uses jQuery UI resizable with east (e) handles positioned at column borders
Minimum column width is set to 105 pixels (approximately 10-13% of container width depending on viewport)
Maximum column width is dynamically calculated as current column width + next column width - minimum width
Column sizes are saved via UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes API call when resize stops
The size viewer displays percentages with a semi-transparent dark background and white text
Resize operations only affect adjacent columns (the column being resized and its immediate neighbor to the right)
Multiple Content Layout modules on the same page can be resized independently
Column percentages are calculated and rounded to whole numbers
